ygData.subject: Re: Rogue deciders
ygData.msgSnippet: Yggdrasil follows outside. Soon, he would know what had become of his cousin, Talos. Yggdrasil: Are you coming with me to negotiate, Devilcat?

Yggdrasil follows outside. Soon, he would know what had become of his
cousin, Talos.

Yggdrasil: Are you coming with me to negotiate, Devilcat?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
<cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> "Very well, Envoy," Devilcat says with a smile.  "I'll show you the 
> way to the Maximal base.  The rest of you, stay put - and be ready to 
> go at a moment's notice."
> 
> The Rogue commander leads the way outside.  He knows full well the 
> objections his fellows would raise if he gave them the chance; until 
> an alliance is officially made, the Maximals are still enemies, and 
> going alone into an enemy camp is dangerous.  But it's a risk he's 
> not prepared to shrug off onto someone else, and if the Maximals are 
> to put their trust in the Rogues, they must be shown the Rogues are 
> willing to trust them.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Yggdrasil thinks for a moment. He figures out that if he is to team 
> up
> > with these guys, he better cooperate now.
> > 
> > Yggdrasil: Consider me as a Maximal Envoy.
> > 
> > He puts his huge hand on the others.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > "The Predacons can't be trusted," warns Gatara.  "And I'd sooner 
> die 
> > > than side with the Tripredacus forces.  That leaves the Maximals."
> > > 
> > > "Indeed.  Shall me make them an offer?" Devilcat invites, 
> extending 
> > > his hand.  One by one, the other Rogues place their hands on his, 
> > > forming a loose circle.  (There's room for Yggdrasil to join, if 
> he 
> > > wants.)
> > > 
> > > "Our greatest strength has always been unity.  I'm glad to see 
> that 
> > > still holds true." Devilcat says with a smile.
